24902115.trustfund:
TF051881-PHRD-VIETNAM: RURAL WATER
            SUPPLY AND SANITATION

repnme.cdata!:
Vietnam - Red River Delta Rural Water
            Supply and Sanitation Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Red River Delta Rural
            Water Supply and Sanitation Project for Vietnam were as
            follows: outcomes were satisfactory, risk to development
            outcome was low or negligible, Bank performance was
            satisfactory, and Borrower performance was satisfactory.
            Some lessons learned included: there is the need to have a
            project design that focuses on end goals and is not too
            rigid in the implementation modalities to achieve these
            results. Project costs need to be underpinned by stronger
            economic analysis, review of macro-economic trends, and
            comparisons with similar interventions in the region. Joint
            stock company model provided successful balance between
            financial sustainability and affordable service delivery of
            water supply and sanitation services. Active community
            participation in planning, supervision, and management of
            rural water supply schemes is critical to success and
            sustainability of interventions. Integration of hygiene
            promotion with sanitation financing coupled with management
            by community organizations effectively built strong demand
            and promoted genuine behavioral changes. Conservative
            disbursement schedule for initial year of project
            implementation and fiduciary management capacity building
            activities during preparation can have alleviated
            bottlenecks during implementation. Adaptive and targeted
            capacity building activities to all project stakeholders
            enhanced awareness, engagement, and ownership of project
            financed infrastructure. Balanced emphasis on provision of
            water supply with sanitation is critical to enhancing
            outcomes of interventions. Public sanitation infrastructure
            needs to be better coordinated and addressed.

repnme.cdata!:
Vietnam - Red River Delta Rural Water
            Supply and Sanitation Project : resettlement action plan

abstracts.cdata!:
The main objective of the Red River
            Delta Rural Water Supply and Sanitation Project for Vietnam
            is to ensure that all displaced persons (DP's) will be
            compensated for their losses at replacement cost and
            provided with rehabilitation measures to assist them to
            improve, or at least maintain, their pre-project living
            standards and income earning capacity. The general mechanism
            for compensation of lost agricultural land will be through
            provision of 'land for land' arrangements of equal
            productive capacity, satisfactory to the DP. If land
            compensation size is smaller or lower quality, DP will be
            entitled to compensation on cash equivalent the differences.
            The level of compensation for the removal of graves will be
            for all costs of excavation, relocation, reburial, and other
            related costs. Compensation in cash will be paid to each
            affected family. Households who possess affected
            facilities/equipment will receive cash compensation at 100
            percent of replacement cost regardless legal or illegal
            users. DPs losing income and/or business/productive assets
            will be given cash compensation for the loss of income
            during the transition period, equivalent average monthly net
            income at least for three months; compensation will also be
            paid for loss of standing crops and trees; temporary impacts
            during construction; temporary loss of residential land;
            temporary impact on business; and loss of community assets.
            Allowances and rehabilitation assistance will be given
            during the transition period. Where damages occur during
            construction, the contractor will be required to pay
            compensation immediately to affected families, groups,
            communities, or government agencies at the same compensation
            rates that shall be applied to all other assets affected by
            the project. In addition, damaged property will be restored
            immediately to its former condition.
